From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Galician

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • seduzir (reintegrationist)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin sēdūcere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • IPA(key): /seduˈθiɾ/ [s̺e.ð̞uˈθiɾ]
  • IPA(key): (standard) /seduˈθiɾ/ [s̺e.ð̞uˈθiɾ]
  • IPA(key): (seseo) /seduˈsiɾ/ [se.ð̞uˈsiɾ]

  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Hyphenation: se‧du‧cir

Verb

[edit]

seducir (first-person singular present seduzo, first-person singular preterite seducín, past participle seducido)

  1. to seduce

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of seducir (c-z alternation)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person

Imperative
Affirmative seduce seduza seduzamos seducide seduzan
Negative (non) non seduzas non seduza non seduzamos non seduzades non seduzan

Related terms

[edit]
  • sedución
  • sedutor

Further reading

[edit]
  • “seducir”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin sēdūcere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /seduˈθiɾ/ [se.ð̞uˈθiɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /seduˈsiɾ/ [se.ð̞uˈsiɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: se‧du‧cir

Verb

[edit]

seducir (first-person singular present seduzco, first-person singular preterite seduje, past participle seducido)

  1. (transitive) to seduce

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of seducir (irregular; c-zc alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund seduciendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular seducido seducida
plural seducidos seducidas

(se) 		sedujese sedujeses sedujese sedujésemos sedujeseis sedujesen

affirmative seducetú
seducívos 		seduzca seduzcamos seducid seduzcan
negative no seduzcas no seduzca no seduzcamos no seduzcáis no seduzcan

1Rare; now chiefly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tuteo-form for the present subjunctive.

Related terms

[edit]
  • seducción
  • seductor
